## Seed plants were the most recent evolutionary step
<hr>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:180px; LEFT:50px; WIDTH:450px; HEIGHT:500px" SRC="images/phylo.jpg">

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:200px; LEFT:550px; WIDTH:450px; HEIGHT:450px" SRC="images/fossil.jpg">

## The big picture: We now live in a seed plant world
<hr>
<br/>

<div style="float: left; width: 50%;">

* **Seeds changed the course of plant evolution**
    + Gymnosperms evolve ~360 mya
    + climate became drier = selection pressures
    + *Elkensia* first fossil seed plant
    
<br/>

* **Seeds consist of embryo & nutrients**
    + surrounded by protective coat
    + seeds can be dispersed long distances
    + supply of stored food

<br/>

* **2 living seed lineages**
    + gymnosperms (<span style="color:blue">naked seed</span>)
    + angiosperms (<span style="color:blue">covered seed</span>)
    
</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:250px; LEFT:525px; WIDTH:250px; HEIGHT:350px" SRC="images/elkplant.jpg">

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:250px; LEFT:800px; WIDTH:250px; HEIGHT:350px" SRC="images/elkplant2.jpg">

## Why seeds matter so much...
<hr>
<br/>

* **Before seeds, spore was only protective structure** 
    + allowed long-distance dispersal but...
    + dependent young embryo still left exposed

<br/>

* **Seeds include multi-cellular <span style="color:purple">endospore</span> = food tissue**

<br/>

* **Embryos can remain dormant for a long time inside seed coat**

<br/>

* **Gymnosperms:** seeds exposed on sporophylls, form cones
* **Angiosperms:** seeds enclosed inside ovary of fruit

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:190px; LEFT:695px; WIDTH:250px; HEIGHT:450px" SRC="images/cones.jpg">

## Seed plants further adapt to life on land
<hr>

<div style="float: left; width: 50%;">

* **Miniaturization of gametophyte**
    + mosses &rarr; ferns &rarr; seed plants
    + gametophyte became microscopic

<br/>

* **Heterosporous life cycle only**
    + *2 kinds of spores*
    + form male or female gametopytes

<br/>

* **<span style="color:purple">Ovules</span> (protect female gametophyte)**
    + ovule contains female spores
    
<br/>

* **<span style="color:purple">Pollen</span> (protect male gametophyte)**
    + male spores develops into pollen grain

    
</div>

## 4 living lineages of gymnosperms
<hr>

<div style="float: left; width: 50%;">

* **Cycads**: 300 living species
    + earliest evidence of insect pollination
    + Cycads and dinosaurs lived together

<br/>

* **Gnteophytes**: small and super weird group
    + source of ephedrine

<br/>

* **Ginkos**: *Ginkgo biloba* is only species left!
    + super common street tree
    
<br/>

* **Conifers**: ~600 species (cones)
    + evergreen and deciduous
    + leaves are needles or scales

</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:190px; LEFT:525px; WIDTH:500px; HEIGHT:450px" SRC="images/gymnos.jpg">

## Gymnosperm reproduction: everything happens on cones
<hr>
<br/>
<br/>

<div style="float: left; width: 50%;">

* **Male and female cones on same plant (mostly)**
    + cone scales &rarr; modified leaves &rarr; sporophyll
    + sporophyll &rarr; sporangia &rarr; spores
    + pollen (male) and ovulate (female) cones

<br/>

* **Male cones house microsporangium**
    + microsporangium produces microspores
    + <span style="color:blue">microspores develop into pollen grains</span>
    + <span style="color:blue">microgametophyte inside pollen grain</span>
    + pollen dispersed by wind
    + *male cones usually on bottom of tree*

</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:250px; LEFT:560px; WIDTH:500px; HEIGHT:350px" SRC="images/malecone.png">


## Gymnosperm reproduction: everything happens on cones
<hr>
<br/>

<div style="float: left; width: 48%;">

* **Female cones have 2 ovules per scale**
    + each ovule has megasproangium
    + megasporangium produce megaspores
    + <span style="color:blue">megaspore develops megagametophyte with egg</span>

<br/>

* **Pollen grain reaches ovule and germinates**
    + pollen tube grows toward megaspore
    + sperm &rarr; pollen tube &rarr; egg (no water!)
    + seed forms, dispersed by wind

<br/>

* **Gymnosperm reproduction requires wind pollination**
    + very inefficient, so lots of pollen produced

</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:250px; LEFT:530px; WIDTH:550px; HEIGHT:350px" SRC="images/femalecone.jpg">

## Flowering plant diversity
<hr>
<br/>

<div style="float: left; width: 49%;">

* **Most diverse living group of plants**
    + 14,000 genera, >250,000 species
    + >90% of plant diversity

</div>

<div style="float: right; width: 49%;">

* **2 classes: Monocots and Dicots**
    + monocots = one seed leaf in embryo
    + dicots = two seed leaf in embryo

</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:310px; LEFT:200px; WIDTH:700px; HEIGHT:375px" SRC="images/angios.jpg">

## Angiosperm evolution: pollination (plants + insects) 
<hr>
**Insect pollination improves on inefficient wind pollination in conifers**

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:250px; LEFT:45px; WIDTH:500px; HEIGHT:350px" SRC="images/butterfly.jpg">

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:250px; LEFT:570px; WIDTH:500px; HEIGHT:350px" SRC="images/ants.jpg">

## Angiosperm reproduction: everything happens on flowers
<hr>
<br/>

<div style="float: left; width: 50%;">

* **Flower is a modified stem for reproduction**
    + with 4 types of modified leaves

<br/>

* **Sepals: leaves at base which enclose flower**
    + usually green

<br/>

* **Petals: colored leaves to attract pollinators**
    + less colored if wind pollinated
    
<br/>

* **Two types of fertile organs to make spores**
    + sporophylls (male and female)
    
</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:190px; LEFT:500px; WIDTH:600px; HEIGHT:450px" SRC="images/flower.jpg">

## Flowers - Male
<hr>
<br/>
<br/>

<div style="float: left; width: 55%;">

* **<span style="color:blue">Stamens</span>: microsporophylls**
    + produce microspores that develop into pollen
    
<br/>    

* **Anther: where microsporangia develop**
    + microspores produced
    + microspores &rarr; pollen
    + pollen &rarr; male gametophyte

<br/>
    
* **Filament: stalk that holds the anther**

</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:190px; LEFT:625px; WIDTH:375px; HEIGHT:450px" SRC="images/flower4.jpg">

## Flowers - Female
<hr>
<br/>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:190px; LEFT:50px; WIDTH:375px; HEIGHT:450px" SRC="images/flower4.jpg">


<div style="float: right; width: 60%;">

* **<span style="color:blue">Carpel</span>: megasporophyll</span>**

<br/>

* **Stigma: receives pollen**
    + sticky

<br/>

* **Style: leads from stigma to ovary**
    + where pollen tube forms
    
<br/>

* **Ovary: contains ovules**
    + megasporangium inside ovule produces megaspores
    + megaspore develops into female gametophyte w/ egg
    + after fertilization, ovary becomes 'fruit'

</div>
